a0.speaker: Youmu:
a0.dialogue: This stormy weather seems very unnatural as if someone is manipulating this kind of weather into existence...

a1.speaker: Youmu:
a1.dialogue: The only thing left is to have this kind of ungodly weather making me think I am a chicken or something slimy...

a2.dialogue: You sound like you are under the effects of my curses already.

a3.speaker: Kaori:
a3.dialogue: But if you want, yeah, whatever. I can curse you to make you think you are a slug during this wonderful weather.

a4.speaker: Youmu:
a4.dialogue: You can do curses? Maybe you were at work with those cursed objects and tombs.

a5.speaker: Kaori:
a5.dialogue: Curses are just a dark side of my ability to grant blessings.

a6.speaker: Kaori:
a6.dialogue: You might know how my abilities work via the story of bread being multiplied to the point of feeding everyone.

a7.speaker: Kaori:
a7.dialogue: Or a similar tale of finding a coin inside a fish's mouth.

a8.speaker: Kaori:
a8.dialogue: To someone with wordy attachments, the coin is nothing but a knickknack, but someone would treat it very differently.

a9.speaker: Youmu:
a9.dialogue: If you can feed the entirety of Gensokyo with that amount of food or make a coin of any value to appear inside of a fish...

a10.speaker: Youmu:
a10.dialogue: Then why not bless us with peace as well as good weather?

a11.speaker: Kaori:
a11.dialogue: You are underestimating my powers, swordswoman...

a12.speaker: Youmu:
a12.dialogue: Uhh... okay. I will take back the words I said earlier...

a13.speaker: Kaori:
a13.dialogue: You think you are gonna be a kind of unholy animal in this kind of weather? Fine, I will do what you will!
